t: Luke 18
Parables on Prayer
Now*p He was telling them a parable to show that at all times they ought to pray and not to lose heart,
saying, “In*r a*r certain*r city*r there*r was*r a*r judge*r who*r did*r not*r fear*r God*r and*r did*r not*r respect*r man.*r
There*r was*r a*r widow*r in*r that*r city,*r and*r she*r kept*r coming*r to*r him,*r saying,*r ‘Give*r me*r legal*r protection*r from*r my*r opponent.’*r
For*r a*r while*r he*r was*r unwilling;*r but*r afterward*r he*r said*r to*r himself,*r ‘Even*r though*r I*r do*r not*r fear*r God*r nor*r respect*r man,*r
yet*r because*r this*r widow*r bothers*r me,*r I*r will*r give*r her*r legal*r protection,*r otherwise*r by*r continually*r coming*r she*r will*r wear*r me*r out.’ ”*r
And the Lord said, “Hear*r what*r the*r unrighteous*r judge*r said;*r
now,*r will*r not*r God*r bring*r about*r justice*r for*r His*r elect*r who*r cry*r to*r Him*r day*r and*r night,*r and*r will*r He*r delay*r long*r over*r them?*r
I*r tell*r you*r that*r He*r will*r bring*r about*r justice*r for*r them*r quickly.*r However,*r when*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r comes,*r will*r He*r find*r faith*r on*r the*r earth?”*r
The Pharisee and the Publican
And*p He also told this parable to some people who trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and viewed others with contempt:
“Two*r men*r went*r up*r into*r the*r temple*r to*r pray,*r one*r a*r Pharisee*r and*r the*r other*r a*r tax*r collector.*r

The*r Pharisee*r stood*r and*r was*r praying*r this*r to*r himself:*r ‘God,*r I*r thank*r You*r that*r I*r am*r not*r like*r other*r people:*r swindlers,*r unjust,*r adulterers,*r or*r even*r like*r this*r tax*r collector.*r
I*r fast*r twice*r a*r week;*r I*r pay*r tithes*r of*r all*r that*r I*r get.’*r

But*r the*r tax*r collector,*r standing*r some*r distance*r away,*r was*r even*r unwilling*r to*r lift*r up*r his*r eyes*r to*r heaven,*r but*r was*r beating*r his*r breast,*r saying,*r ‘God,*r be*r merciful*r to*r me,*r the*r sinner!’*r

I*r tell*r you,*r this*r man*r went*r to*r his*r house*r justified*r rather*r than*r the*r other;*r for*r everyone*r who*r exalts*r himself*r will*r be*r humbled,*r but*r he*r who*r humbles*r himself*r will*r be*r exalted.”*r
And*p they were bringing even their babies to Him so that He would touch them, but when the disciples saw it, they began*i rebuking them.
But Jesus called for them, saying, “Permit*r the*r children*r to*r come*r to*r Me,*r and*r do*r not*r hinder*r them,*r for*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r belongs*r to*r such*r as*r these.*r
Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r whoever*r does*r not*r receive*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r like*r a*r child*r will*r not*r enter*r it*r at*ir all.”*ir
The Rich Young Ruler
A*p ruler questioned Him, saying, “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
And Jesus said to him, “Why*r do*r you*r call*r Me*r good?*r No*r one*r is*r good*r except*r God*r alone.*r

You*r know*r the*r commandments,*r ‘Do*sr not*sr commit*sr adultery,*sr Do*sr not*sr murder,*sr Do*sr not*sr steal,*sr Do*sr not*sr bear*sr false*sr witness,*sr Honor*sr your*sr father*sr and*sr mother*sr .’ ”*r
And he said, “All these things I have kept from my*i youth.”

When Jesus heard this,*i He said to him, “One*r thing*r you*r still*r lack;*r sell*r all*r that*r you*r possess*r and*r distribute*r it*r to*r the*r poor,*r and*r you*r shall*r have*r treasure*r in*r heaven;*r and*r come,*r follow*r Me.”*r
But when he had heard these things, he became very sad, for he was extremely rich.
And Jesus looked at him and said, “How*r hard*r it*r is*r for*r those*r who*r are*r wealthy*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!*r
For*r it*r is*r easier*r for*r a*r camel*r to*r go*r through*r the*r eye*r of*r a*r needle*r than*r for*r a*r rich*r man*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
They who heard it said, “Then who can be saved?”
But He said, “The*r things*r that*r are*r impossible*r with*r people*r are*r possible*r with*r God.”*r
Peter*p said, “Behold, we have left our own homes*i and followed You.”

And He said to them, “Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r there*r is*r no*r one*r who*r has*r left*r house*r or*r wife*r or*r brothers*r or*r parents*r or*r children,*r for*r the*r sake*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God,*r
who*r will*r not*r receive*r many*r times*r as*r much*r at*r this*r time*r and*r in*r the*r age*r to*r come,*r eternal*r life.”*r

Then*p He took the twelve aside and said to them, “Behold,*r we*r are*r going*r up*r to*r Jerusalem,*r and*r all*r things*r which*r are*r written*r through*r the*r prophets*r about*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r accomplished.*r
For*r He*r will*r be*r handed*r over*r to*r the*r Gentiles,*r and*r will*r be*r mocked*r and*r mistreated*r and*r spit*r upon,*r
and*r after*r they*r have*r scourged*r Him,*r they*r will*r kill*r Him;*r and*r the*r third*r day*r He*r will*r rise*r again.”*r
But the disciples understood none of these things, and the*i meaning*i of*i this statement was hidden from them, and they did not comprehend the things that were said.
Bartimaeus Receives Sight
As*p Jesus was approaching Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the road begging.
Now hearing a crowd going by, he began*i to inquire what this was.
They told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by.
And he called out, saying, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Those who led the way were sternly telling him to be quiet; but he kept crying out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
And Jesus stopped and commanded that he be brought to Him; and when he came near, He questioned him,
“What*r do*r you*r want*r Me*r to*r do*r for*r you?”*r And he said, “Lord, I*i want*i to regain my sight!”
And Jesus said to him, “Receive*r your*r sight;*r your*r faith*r has*r made*r you*r well.”*r
Immediately he regained his sight and began*i following Him, glorifying God; and when all the people saw it, they gave praise to God.
